definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)

sentences.english: The children are itching for the film to begin.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們不耐煩地等着電影開映。

sentences.english: What time does the film begin?
Some guys are talking loudly while the film is on.
sentences.chinese: 電影開映的時候，還有些人在大聲說話。

sentences.english: By the time they got to the cinema, the film had already begun. (
sentences.chinese: 他們趕到電影院時，電影已經開映了。
